channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Recurring commercial flytipping issue, 13th February
item.description:
Flytipping of commercial waste has been a recurring issue here for the best part of a year. Neighbours have to move the litter to the appropriate collection point on Mare Street which isn’t their responsibility, especially considering council tax fees…

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: HGV mud on exit to demolition site at 52 Cambridge Road, 13th February
item.description:
Dangerous excess mud on pavement and roadway which could cause slips, outside the demolition site at 52 Cambridge Road. I witnessed this on two consecutive days. The development has a CEMP which requires them to remove excess mud from HGVs. Please could this be removed. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Deep pothole, 13th February
item.description:
Really deep pothole on the top of Brunswick Park road. Just as you turn in from the roundabout. You can’t even see it at all in the dark till you’ve hit it. Very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Brunswick Park Road, Brunswick Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hampstead grove, 13th February
item.description:
I am writing to formally report a serious road defect and to submit a claim for damages caused to my vehicle while driving along Hampstead Grove on Tuesday, 10 February 2026. On this date, my car struck a large pothole on Hampstead Grove, resulting in a burst tyre and a cracked wheel. The impact was significant and caused immediate and costly damage. I have since had to replace the tyre at a cost of £408 from Mobile Tyre Giant, and I purchased a replacement rim for £567 from eBay. Please find attached the images and video showing the condition of the pothole, as well as the damage to my vehicle. I kindly request that the council investigate this matter and advise on the process for submitting a reimbursement claim for the expenses incurred as a result of this road defect. Thank you for your attention to this issue, and I look forward to your prompt response. Yours faithfully, David Davidian
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead Grove, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown island, 13th February
item.description:
The island at the junction of Villacourt rd and Alliance rd has become so over grown that a car nearly hit me head on today and its not the first near miss i have had. Trying to turn right into Alliance from Villacourt you have to pull right out to look left. Years ago there was no large vegetation so a clear vision could be seen all round now its awful. There will be a serious accident one day. If it cannot be kept under control then why isn't it paved over.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alliance Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7x16 inch deep pothole, 13th February
item.description:
The pothole has been "patched" various times over the years and never fully repaired. It causes mass issues to cars suspension and steering alignments. Bikes and mopeds swerve to avoid it as hitting it will make them flip, you could easily stand in it for the depth and width of it. Being a main bus/lorry route this is destroying the road and will subsidise soon enough if not delt with.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136, Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
